comments:
Objective: 
Provide quality comprehensive RH services and promote reproductive health rights

Target groups: 
Refugee and Host community (30%) women, men, girls and boys in Dayr Alla

Description of the Project:
IFH will provide critical outreach activities targeting Syrian refugees within the host community to disseminate information on the availability and type of services available to Syrians, and increase access to quality RH and GBV services.

Activities include:
- Conduct awareness activities on RH & GBV
- Provision of RH related medical \ counseling services
- Perform specialized home visits
- Distribution of IEC material
- Conduct campaigns on RH & GBV

activity: 1. Referral system for sec. & ter. care
Indicator: Syrian Men in Urban - # referred for secondary and tertiary level

activity: 2. Community level referral system in place
Indicator: community level referral system established?
comments: IRD's community health referral systems are implemented through two comparable programs, Health Linkages and National Networks (in Amman, Zarqa, and Irbid) and Health Services for Syrian Refugees (Irbid, Ramtha-Irbid, Mafraq, Zarqa, Salt, Karak, Ma'an). Both involve teams of Community Health Volunteers (CHVs), who conduct health assessments through home visits for refugees and Jordanian residents of host communities, provide increased awareness of healthcare options (saving time and trouble for both beneficiaries and clinics), and make referrals to local Ministry of Health clinics. They follow up with patients throughout their treatment, ensuring that referrals for higher level care are given when necessary, and conducting exit interviews upon completion of treatment to evaluate services. When NFI donations are available they are also often circulated through CHVs.

Syrian Women in Urban - # of GBV survivor who access medical care
comments:
Comments: Project title:
a practical emergency prevention and response to GBV and RH among Syrian refugees in Jordan

Objectives:
- To improve awareness and access to quality GBV comprehensive services
- Improve the capacity of heath units to provide clinical management of rape

Target groups:
1. Refugee and host communities (30%) women, girls, men and boys
2. Partner CBOs and health providers dealing with GBV cases

Description of Activities:
- IFH Psychologists provide psychosocial services and counseling to GBV identified cases
-Training of CBO members and health providers on MISP, Clinical Management of Rape, Code of Conduct, Referral systems (SOP), RH & GBV basics
- Provision of basic and comprehensive RH & GBV medical and counseling services

Objective: 
Provide quality comprehensive RH services and promote reproductive health rights

Target groups: 
Refugee and Host community (30%) women, men, girls and boys in Dayr Alla

Description of the Project:
IFH will provide critical outreach activities targeting Syrian refugees within the host community to disseminate information on the availability and type of services available to Syrians, and increase access to quality RH and GBV services.

Activities include:
- Conduct awareness activities on RH & GBV
- Provision of RH related medical \ counseling services
- Perform specialized home visits
- Distribution of IEC material
- Conduct campaigns on RH & GBV

Target groups:

activity: 2. Community level referral system in place
Indicator: community level referral system established?
comments: IRD's community health referral systems are implemented through two comparable programs, Health Linkages and National Networks (in Amman, Zarqa, and Irbid) and Health Services for Syrian Refugees (Irbid, Ramtha-Irbid, Mafraq, Zarqa, Salt, Karak, Ma'an). Both involve teams of Community Health Volunteers (CHVs), who conduct health assessments through home visits for refugees and Jordanian residents of host communities, provide increased awareness of healthcare options (saving time and trouble for both beneficiaries and clinics), and make referrals to local Ministry of Health clinics. They follow up with patients throughout their treatment, ensuring that referrals for higher level care are given when necessary, and conducting exit interviews upon completion of treatment to evaluate services. When NFI donations are available they are also often circulated through CHVs.

activity: 2. Community level referral system in place
Indicator: community level referral system established?
comments: IRD's community health referral systems are implemented through two comparable programs, Health Linkages and National Networks (in Amman, Zarqa, and Irbid) and Health Services for Syrian Refugees (Irbid, Ramtha-Irbid, Mafraq, Zarqa, Salt, Karak, Ma'an). Both involve teams of Community Health Volunteers (CHVs), who conduct health assessments through home visits for refugees and Jordanian residents of host communities, provide increased awareness of healthcare options (saving time and trouble for both beneficiaries and clinics), and make referrals to local Ministry of Health clinics. They follow up with patients throughout their treatment, ensuring that referrals for higher level care are given when necessary, and conducting exit interviews upon completion of treatment to evaluate services. When NFI donations are available they are also often circulated through CHVs.

comments:
Project Title: Provision of multidisciplinary services for Refugees and Asylum Seekers in Jordan (Syrian) 
Target group:
1-the vulnerable group of Syrian refugee families registered with the UNHCR, especially those with special needs, women, children, the elderly in the community and in the refugee camps.
2-The Community based organizations CBOs Implementing partners and
Funded By: The UN Refugee Agency UNHCR
Activities:
1-To provide rehabilitation services and psycho-social support for children with disabilities from mental disabilities and physical- minor to moderate-, learning difficulties and problems of language and speech therapy, and physical therapy sessions. And provide advising sessions for their parents. And provide children in need with hearing aids.
2-Screeninng for cases and to be  identified and provide with basic and advanced  psychological sessions awareness-raising sessions.
3-Separated children: educational sessions and support groups for separated and unaccompanied children ,workshops, and various activities.
4-To strengthen the local community and build the capacity of workers at CBOs and volunteer training, committees,  have cac meetings 
5-Provide psychological and social services for abused women in the community (sexual violence and gender based violence GBV) as well screening for cases of women subjected to violence on the basis of gender-based, and refer cases to specialized care to provide counseling sessions (medical, social, psychological and legal) for those women.
6- Provide psychological and social services individual and groups sessions (basic and advanced, referral) for those who are having psychological problems ( like bed wetting for children adjustment problems for adultsetc) concentrating on child protection( cp) :prevention, procedures, response, referrals, trainings and workshops
7- cfs for children

CVT Center located in Al Hashmi Al Shamali (North Hashmi).

2-The Community based organizations CBOs Implementing partners and
Funded By: The UN Refugee Agency UNHCR
Activities:
1-To provide rehabilitation services and psycho-social support for children with disabilities from mental disabilities and physical- minor to moderate-, learning difficulties and problems of language and speech therapy, and physical therapy sessions. And provide advising sessions for their parents. And provide children in need with hearing aids.
2-Screeninng for cases and to be  identified and provide with basic and advanced  psychological sessions awareness-raising sessions.
3-Separated children: educational sessions and support groups for separated and unaccompanied children ,workshops, and various activities.
4-To strengthen the local community and build the capacity of workers at CBOs and volunteer training, committees,  have cac meetings 
5-Provide psychological and social services for abused women in the community (sexual violence and gender based violence GBV) as well screening for cases of women subjected to violence on the basis of gender-based, and refer cases to specialized care to provide counseling sessions (medical, social, psychological and legal) for those women.
6- Provide psychological and social services individual and groups sessions (basic and advanced, referral) for those who are having psychological problems ( like bed wetting for children adjustment problems for adultsetc) concentrating on child protection( cp) :prevention, procedures, response, referrals, trainings and workshops
7- cfs for children

Indicator: Number of clinical secondary mental health consultations provided to Syrian women 18 and over in urban setting

Indicator: Number of antenatal consultations provided to non-Syrian women over 18 that month
comments:
Objective: 
Provide quality comprehensive RH services and promote reproductive health rights

Target groups: 
Refugee and Host community (30%) women, men, girls and boys in Amman (Sweileh and Al Hashmi)

Description of the Project:
IFH will provide critical outreach activities targeting Syrian refugees within the host community to disseminate information on the availability and type of services available to Syrians, and increase access to quality RH and GBV services.

Activities include:
- Conduct awareness activities on RH & GBV
- Provision of RH related medical \ counseling services
- Perform specialized home visits
- Distribution of IEC material
- Conduct campaigns on RH & GBV

activity: 5. Improve access to mental health service
Indicator: # number of facilities providing mental health services during this month
comments:
Support the integration of mental health in PHC through the delivery of mhGAP supervision and provision of tools to 16 facilities in Amman, Mafraq, Irbid and Ramtha, in coordination with MOH Mental Health Unit. 

Target is 8 additional PHC facilities, bringing total number to 24 facilities (country-wide).

Indicator: Number of female health workers (government, CBOs and national NGOs) who have received a complete training session that month
comments:
Capacity-building of health and social service providers working with the target population. 
February 2014 Trainings: 
(1) Interviewing War Trauma and Torture Survivors to Danish Refugee Council (DRC) and Jordan Hashemite Charity Organization for Relief & Development (JHCO), 
(2) Self-care and Stress Management to Danish Refugee Council (DRC) and Jordan Hashemite Charity Organization for Relief & Development (JHCO), and
(3) Self-care for Care Providers to Syrian Bright Future (SBF).

comments:
CVT Center located in Al Hashmi Al Shamali (North Hashmi).
Number of newly registered clients per month (number of ongoing clients from previous months who were provided services during the reporting month are not including to avoid that the same clients be counted more than once). 
Age group cut-point is 18 years old (girls/boys are below 18 Y/O; women/men are 18 and above). 
The category "Men - Other affected Population" is lacking. In January 2014, 33 "men - other affected population" registered with CVT in Amman.
(Funding resources: BPRM; USAID; UNVFTV; Others)

Indicator: Number of clinical secondary mental health consultations provided to men 18 and over (non Syrian)
comments:
Project Title: Provision of multidisciplinary services for Refugees and Asylum Seekers in Jordan (Syrian) 
Target group:
1-the vulnerable group of Syrian refugee families registered with the UNHCR, especially those with special needs, women, children, the elderly in the community and in the refugee camps.
2-The Community based organizations CBOs Implementing partners and
Funded By: The UN Refugee Agency UNHCR
Activities:
1-To provide rehabilitation services and psycho-social support for children with disabilities from mental disabilities and physical- minor to moderate-, learning difficulties and problems of language and speech therapy, and physical therapy sessions. And provide advising sessions for their parents. And provide children in need with hearing aids.
2-Screeninng for cases and to be  identified and provide with basic and advanced  psychological sessions awareness-raising sessions.
3-Separated children: educational sessions and support groups for separated and unaccompanied children ,workshops, and various activities.
4-To strengthen the local community and build the capacity of workers at CBOs and volunteer training, committees,  have cac meetings 
5-Provide psychological and social services for abused women in the community (sexual violence and gender based violence GBV) as well screening for cases of women subjected to violence on the basis of gender-based, and refer cases to specialized care to provide counseling sessions (medical, social, psychological and legal) for those women.
6- Provide psychological and social services individual and groups sessions (basic and advanced, referral) for those who are having psychological problems ( like bed wetting for children adjustment problems for adultsetc) concentrating on child protection( cp) :prevention, procedures, response, referrals, trainings and workshops
7- cfs for children

activity: 2. Community level referral system in place
Indicator: community level referral system established?
comments: IRD's community health referral systems are implemented through two comparable programs, Health Linkages and National Networks (in Amman, Zarqa, and Irbid) and Health Services for Syrian Refugees (Irbid, Ramtha-Irbid, Mafraq, Zarqa, Salt, Karak, Ma'an). Both involve teams of Community Health Volunteers (CHVs), who conduct health assessments through home visits for refugees and Jordanian residents of host communities, provide increased awareness of healthcare options (saving time and trouble for both beneficiaries and clinics), and make referrals to local Ministry of Health clinics. They follow up with patients throughout their treatment, ensuring that referrals for higher level care are given when necessary, and conducting exit interviews upon completion of treatment to evaluate services. When NFI donations are available they are also often circulated through CHVs.

Indicator: Syrian Boys in Urban - # referred for secondary and tertiary level
Number of antenatal consultations provided to Syrian women 18 and over in urban setting that month
comments:
Objective: 
Provide quality comprehensive RH services and promote reproductive health rights

Target groups: 
Refugee and Host community (30%) women, men, girls and boys in Amman (Sweileh and Al Hashmi)

Description of the Project:
IFH will provide critical outreach activities targeting Syrian refugees within the host community to disseminate information on the availability and type of services available to Syrians, and increase access to quality RH and GBV services.

Activities include:
- Conduct awareness activities on RH & GBV
- Provision of RH related medical \ counseling services
- Perform specialized home visits
- Distribution of IEC material
- Conduct campaigns on RH & GBV

1-To provide rehabilitation services and psycho-social support for children with disabilities from mental disabilities and physical- minor to moderate-, learning difficulties and problems of language and speech therapy, and physical therapy sessions. And provide advising sessions for their parents. And provide children in need with hearing aids.
2-Screeninng for cases and to be  identified and provide with basic and advanced  psychological sessions awareness-raising sessions.
3-Separated children: educational sessions and support groups for separated and unaccompanied children ,workshops, and various activities.
4-To strengthen the local community and build the capacity of workers at CBOs and volunteer training, committees,  have cac meetings 
5-Provide psychological and social services for abused women in the community (sexual violence and gender based violence GBV) as well screening for cases of women subjected to violence on the basis of gender-based, and refer cases to specialized care to provide counseling sessions (medical, social, psychological and legal) for those women.
6- Provide psychological and social services individual and groups sessions (basic and advanced, referral) for those who are having psychological problems ( like bed wetting for children adjustment problems for adultsetc) concentrating on child protection( cp) :prevention, procedures, response, referrals, trainings and workshops
7- cfs for children

Indicator: Number of antenatal consultations provided to Syrian  girls under 18 in urban setting that month
comments:
Objective: 
Provide quality comprehensive RH services and promote reproductive health rights

Target groups: 
Refugee and Host community (30%) women, men, girls and boys in Amman (Sweileh and Al Hashmi)

Description of the Project:
IFH will provide critical outreach activities targeting Syrian refugees within the host community to disseminate information on the availability and type of services available to Syrians, and increase access to quality RH and GBV services.

Activities include:
- Conduct awareness activities on RH & GBV
- Provision of RH related medical \ counseling services
- Perform specialized home visits
- Distribution of IEC material
- Conduct campaigns on RH & GBV

Indicator: # caregivers/ mothers reached with IYCF services

activity: 2. Community level referral system in place
Indicator: community level referral system established?
comments: IRD's community health referral systems are implemented through two comparable programs, Health Linkages and National Networks (in Amman, Zarqa, and Irbid) and Health Services for Syrian Refugees (Irbid, Ramtha-Irbid, Mafraq, Zarqa, Salt, Karak, Ma'an). Both involve teams of Community Health Volunteers (CHVs), who conduct health assessments through home visits for refugees and Jordanian residents of host communities, provide increased awareness of healthcare options (saving time and trouble for both beneficiaries and clinics), and make referrals to local Ministry of Health clinics. They follow up with patients throughout their treatment, ensuring that referrals for higher level care are given when necessary, and conducting exit interviews upon completion of treatment to evaluate services. When NFI donations are available they are also often circulated through CHVs.

Indicator: Syrian Girls in Urban - # of GBV survivor who access medical care
comments:
Project title:
a practical emergency prevention and response to GBV and RH among Syrian refugees in Jordan

Objectives:
- To improve awareness and access to quality GBV comprehensive services
-  Improve the capacity of heath units to provide clinical management of rape

Target groups:
1. Refugee and host communities (30%) women, girls, men and boys
2. Partner CBOs and health providers dealing with GBV cases

Description of Activities:
- IFH Psychologists provide psychosocial services and counseling to GBV identified cases

activity: 2. Community level referral system in place
Indicator: community level referral system established?
comments: IRD's community health referral systems are implemented through two comparable programs, Health Linkages and National Networks (in Amman, Zarqa, and Irbid) and Health Services for Syrian Refugees (Irbid, Ramtha-Irbid, Mafraq, Zarqa, Salt, Karak, Ma'an). Both involve teams of Community Health Volunteers (CHVs), who conduct health assessments through home visits for refugees and Jordanian residents of host communities, provide increased awareness of healthcare options (saving time and trouble for both beneficiaries and clinics), and make referrals to local Ministry of Health clinics. They follow up with patients throughout their treatment, ensuring that referrals for higher level care are given when necessary, and conducting exit interviews upon completion of treatment to evaluate services. When NFI donations are available they are also often circulated through CHVs.

comments:
Objective: 
Provide quality comprehensive RH services and promote reproductive health rights

Target groups: 
Refugee and Host community (30%) women, men, girls and boys in Amman (Sweileh and Al Hashmi)

Description of the Project:
IFH will provide critical outreach activities targeting Syrian refugees within the host community to disseminate information on the availability and type of services available to Syrians, and increase access to quality RH and GBV services.

Activities include:
- Conduct awareness activities on RH & GBV
- Provision of RH related medical \ counseling services
- Perform specialized home visits
- Distribution of IEC material
- Conduct campaigns on RH & GBV

comments:
Project Title: Provision of multidisciplinary services for Refugees and Asylum Seekers in Jordan (Syrian) 
Target group:
1-the vulnerable group of Syrian refugee families registered with the UNHCR, especially those with special needs, women, children, the elderly in the community and in the refugee camps.
2-The Community based organizations CBOs Implementing partners and
Funded By: The UN Refugee Agency UNHCR
Activities:
1-To provide rehabilitation services and psycho-social support for children with disabilities from mental disabilities and physical- minor to moderate-, learning difficulties and problems of language and speech therapy, and physical therapy sessions. And provide advising sessions for their parents. And provide children in need with hearing aids.
2-Screeninng for cases and to be  identified and provide with basic and advanced  psychological sessions awareness-raising sessions.
3-Separated children: educational sessions and support groups for separated and unaccompanied children ,workshops, and various activities.
4-To strengthen the local community and build the capacity of workers at CBOs and volunteer training, committees,  have cac meetings 
5-Provide psychological and social services for abused women in the community (sexual violence and gender based violence GBV) as well screening for cases of women subjected to violence on the basis of gender-based, and refer cases to specialized care to provide counseling sessions (medical, social, psychological and legal) for those women.
6- Provide psychological and social services individual and groups sessions (basic and advanced, referral) for those who are having psychological problems ( like bed wetting for children adjustment problems for adultsetc) concentrating on child protection( cp) :prevention, procedures, response, referrals, trainings and workshops
7- cfs for children

Indicator: Number of antenatal consultations provided to non-Syrian women over 18 that month
comments:
Objective: 
Provide quality comprehensive RH services and promote reproductive health rights

Target groups: 
Refugee and Host community (30%) women, men, girls and boys in Amman (Sweileh and Al Hashmi)

Description of the Project:
IFH will provide critical outreach activities targeting Syrian refugees within the host community to disseminate information on the availability and type of services available to Syrians, and increase access to quality RH and GBV services.

Activities include:
- Conduct awareness activities on RH & GBV
- Provision of RH related medical \ counseling services
- Perform specialized home visits
- Distribution of IEC material
- Conduct campaigns on RH & GBV

comments:
Project Title: Provision of multidisciplinary services for Refugees and Asylum Seekers in Jordan (Syrian) 
Target group:
1-the vulnerable group of Syrian refugee families registered with the UNHCR, especially those with special needs, women, children, the elderly in the community and in the refugee camps.
2-The Community based organizations CBOs Implementing partners and
Funded By: The UN Refugee Agency UNHCR
Activities:
1-To provide rehabilitation services and psycho-social support for children with disabilities from mental disabilities and physical- minor to moderate-, learning difficulties and problems of language and speech therapy, and physical therapy sessions. And provide advising sessions for their parents. And provide children in need with hearing aids.
2-Screeninng for cases and to be  identified and provide with basic and advanced  psychological sessions awareness-raising sessions.
3-Separated children: educational sessions and support groups for separated and unaccompanied children ,workshops, and various activities.
4-To strengthen the local community and build the capacity of workers at CBOs and volunteer training, committees,  have cac meetings 
5-Provide psychological and social services for abused women in the community (sexual violence and gender based violence GBV) as well screening for cases of women subjected to violence on the basis of gender-based, and refer cases to specialized care to provide counseling sessions (medical, social, psychological and legal) for those women.
6- Provide psychological and social services individual and groups sessions (basic and advanced, referral) for those who are having psychological problems ( like bed wetting for children adjustment problems for adultsetc) concentrating on child protection( cp) :prevention, procedures, response, referrals, trainings and workshops
7- cfs for children

activity: 1. Community health volunteer teams in place
Indicator: # of female community health volunteers trained and supported
comments: Community Health Volunteers under one of two IRD health programs, Health Linkages and National Networks (in Amman, Zarqa, and Irbid) and Health Services for Syrian Refugees (Irbid, Ramtha-Irbid, Mafraq, Zarqa, Salt, Karak, Ma'an), conduct health assessments through home visits, make referrals to local Ministry of Health clinics, and spread awareness about healthcare options, and sometimes distribute NFIs to refugees.

activity: 2. Community level referral system in place
Indicator: community level referral system established?
comments: IRD's community health referral systems are implemented through two comparable programs, Health Linkages and National Networks (in Amman, Zarqa, and Irbid) and Health Services for Syrian Refugees (Irbid, Ramtha-Irbid, Mafraq, Zarqa, Salt, Karak, Ma'an). Both involve teams of Community Health Volunteers (CHVs), who conduct health assessments through home visits for refugees and Jordanian residents of host communities, provide increased awareness of healthcare options (saving time and trouble for both beneficiaries and clinics), and make referrals to local Ministry of Health clinics. They follow up with patients throughout their treatment, ensuring that referrals for higher level care are given when necessary, and conducting exit interviews upon completion of treatment to evaluate services. When NFI donations are available they are also often circulated through CHVs.

Indicator: Number of rehabilitation sessions conducted by a Physical Therapist and/or Occupational Therapist provided to girls under 18 (non Syrian)
comments:
Project Title: Provision of multidisciplinary services for Refugees and Asylum Seekers in Jordan (Syrian) 
Target group:
1-the vulnerable group of Syrian refugee families registered with the UNHCR, especially those with special needs, women, children, the elderly in the community and in the refugee camps.
2-The Community based organizations CBOs Implementing partners and
Funded By: The UN Refugee Agency UNHCR
Activities:
1-To provide rehabilitation services and psycho-social support for children with disabilities from mental disabilities and physical- minor to moderate-, learning difficulties and problems of language and speech therapy, and physical therapy sessions. And provide advising sessions for their parents. And provide children in need with hearing aids.
2-Screeninng for cases and to be  identified and provide with basic and advanced  psychological sessions awareness-raising sessions.
3-Separated children: educational sessions and support groups for separated and unaccompanied children ,workshops, and various activities.
4-To strengthen the local community and build the capacity of workers at CBOs and volunteer training, committees,  have cac meetings 
5-Provide psychological and social services for abused women in the community (sexual violence and gender based violence GBV) as well screening for cases of women subjected to violence on the basis of gender-based, and refer cases to specialized care to provide counseling sessions (medical, social, psychological and legal) for those women.
6- Provide psychological and social services individual and groups sessions (basic and advanced, referral) for those who are having psychological problems ( like bed wetting for children adjustment problems for adultsetc) concentrating on child protection( cp) :prevention, procedures, response, referrals, trainings and workshops
7- cfs for children

activity: 1. Community health volunteer teams in place
Indicator: # of male  community health volunteers trained and supported
comments:
Objective:
Provide quality comprehensive RH services and promote reproductive health rights

Target groups:
Refugee and Host community (30%) women, men, girls and boys

Description of the Project:
IFH will provide critical outreach activities targeting Syrian refugees within the host community to disseminate information on the availability and type of services available to Syrians, and increase access to quality RH and GBV services.

Activities include:
- Conduct awareness activities on RH & GBV
- Provision of RH related medical \ counseling services
- Perform specialized home visits
- Distribution of IEC material
- Conduct campaigns on RH & GBV

Indicator: Syrian Boys in Urban - # of GBV survivor who access medical care
comments:
Project title:
a practical emergency prevention and response to GBV and RH among Syrian refugees in Jordan

Objectives:
- To improve awareness and access to quality GBV comprehensive services
-  Improve the capacity of heath units to provide clinical management of rape

Target groups:
1. Refugee and host communities (30%) women, girls, men and boys
2. Partner CBOs and health providers dealing with GBV cases

Description of Activities:
- IFH Psychologists provide psychosocial services and counseling to GBV identified cases
-Training of CBO members and health providers on MISP, Clinical Management of Rape, Code of Conduct, Referral systems (SOP), RH & GBV basics
- Provision of basic and comprehensive RH & GBV medical and counseling services

comments:
Capacity-building of health and social service providers working with the target population. 
February 2014 Trainings: 
(1) Interviewing War Trauma and Torture Survivors to Danish Refugee Council (DRC) and Jordan Hashemite Charity Organization for Relief & Development (JHCO), 
(2) Self-care and Stress Management to Danish Refugee Council (DRC) and Jordan Hashemite Charity Organization for Relief & Development (JHCO), and
(3) Self-care for Care Providers to Syrian Bright Future (SBF).

comments:
Objective of the Project:
Provide quality comprehensive RH services and promote reproductive health rights

The project includes a capacity building component:
* Training Activities for Community Based Organizations (CBOs) Members, Health Providers and Local Clinics
National Training on the following subjects: 

- Capacity building of CBOs' members on RH & GBV Basics, Referral Systems and Codes of Conduct (CoC)

- Health Provider and local clinic training on MISP, RH protocols, FP Counseling and Clinical Management of Rape (CMR)

Target groups:
- CBOs working with Syrian Refugees
- Health Providers in CBOs, MOH clinics, local & international NGOs working with Syrian Refugees

Objectives:

comments: Community Health Volunteers under one of two IRD health programs, Health Linkages and National Networks (in Amman, Zarqa, and Irbid) and Health Services for Syrian Refugees (Irbid, Ramtha-Irbid, Mafraq, Zarqa, Salt, Karak, Ma'an), conduct health assessments through home visits, make referrals to local Ministry of Health clinics, and spread awareness about healthcare options, and sometimes distribute NFIs to refugees.

activity: 1. Referral system for sec. & ter. care

activity: 2. Community level referral system in place
Indicator: community level referral system established?
comments: IRD's community health referral systems are implemented through two comparable programs, Health Linkages and National Networks (in Amman, Zarqa, and Irbid) and Health Services for Syrian Refugees (Irbid, Ramtha-Irbid, Mafraq, Zarqa, Salt, Karak, Ma'an). Both involve teams of Community Health Volunteers (CHVs), who conduct health assessments through home visits for refugees and Jordanian residents of host communities, provide increased awareness of healthcare options (saving time and trouble for both beneficiaries and clinics), and make referrals to local Ministry of Health clinics. They follow up with patients throughout their treatment, ensuring that referrals for higher level care are given when necessary, and conducting exit interviews upon completion of treatment to evaluate services. When NFI donations are available they are also often circulated through CHVs.

And provide advising sessions for their parents. And provide children in need with hearing aids.
2-Screeninng for cases and to be  identified and provide with basic and advanced  psychological sessions awareness-raising sessions.
3-Separated children: educational sessions and support groups for separated and unaccompanied children ,workshops, and various activities.
4-To strengthen the local community and build the capacity of workers at CBOs and volunteer training, committees,  have cac meetings 
5-Provide psychological and social services for abused women in the community (sexual violence and gender based violence GBV) as well screening for cases of women subjected to violence on the basis of gender-based, and refer cases to specialized care to provide counseling sessions (medical, social, psychological and legal) for those women.
6- Provide psychological and social services individual and groups sessions (basic and advanced, referral) for those who are having psychological problems ( like bed wetting for children adjustment problems for adultsetc) concentrating on child protection( cp) :prevention, procedures, response, referrals, trainings and workshops
7- cfs for children

comments:
Project title:
a practical emergency prevention and response to GBV and RH among Syrian refugees in Jordan

Objectives:
- To improve awareness and access to quality GBV comprehensive services
-  Improve the capacity of heath units to provide clinical management of rape

Target groups:
1. Refugee and host communities (30%) women, girls, men and boys
2. Partner CBOs and health providers dealing with GBV cases

Description of Activities:
- IFH Psychologists provide psychosocial services and counseling to GBV identified cases
-Training of CBO members and health providers on MISP, Clinical Management of Rape, Code of Conduct, Referral systems (SOP), RH & GBV basics
- Provision of basic and comprehensive RH & GBV medical and counseling services

comments:
Objective:
Provide quality comprehensive RH services and promote reproductive health rights

Target groups:
Refugee and Host community (30%) women, men, girls and boys

Description of the Project:
IFH will provide critical outreach activities targeting Syrian refugees within the host community to disseminate information on the availability and type of services available to Syrians, and increase access to quality RH and GBV services.

Activities include:
- Conduct awareness activities on RH & GBV
- Provision of RH related medical \ counseling services
- Perform specialized home visits
- Distribution of IEC material
- Conduct campaigns on RH & GBV

comments:
Project title:
a practical emergency prevention and response to GBV and RH among Syrian refugees in Jordan

Objectives:
- To improve awareness and access to quality GBV comprehensive services
-  Improve the capacity of heath units to provide clinical management of rape

Target groups:
1. Refugee and host communities (30%) women, girls, men and boys
2. Partner CBOs and health providers dealing with GBV cases

Description of Activities:
- IFH Psychologists provide psychosocial services and counseling to GBV identified cases
-Training of CBO members and health providers on MISP, Clinical Management of Rape, Code of Conduct, Referral systems (SOP), RH & GBV basics
- Provision of basic and comprehensive RH & GBV medical and counseling services

comments:
Objective of the Project:
Provide quality comprehensive RH services and promote reproductive health rights

The project includes a capacity building component:
* Training Activities for Community Based Organizations (CBOs) Members, Health Providers and Local Clinics
National Training on the following subjects: 

- Capacity building of CBOs' members on RH & GBV Basics, Referral Systems and Codes of Conduct (CoC)

- Health Provider and local clinic training on MISP, RH protocols, FP Counseling and Clinical Management of Rape (CMR)

Target groups:
- CBOs working with Syrian Refugees
- Health Providers in CBOs, MOH clinics, local & international NGOs working with Syrian Refugees

comments:
Project Title: Provision of multidisciplinary services for Refugees and Asylum Seekers in Jordan (Syrian) 
Target group:
1-the vulnerable group of Syrian refugee families registered with the UNHCR, especially those with special needs, women, children, the elderly in the community and in the refugee camps.
2-The Community based organizations CBOs Implementing partners and
Funded By: The UN Refugee Agency UNHCR
Activities:
1-To provide rehabilitation services and psycho-social support for children with disabilities from mental disabilities and physical- minor to moderate-, learning difficulties and problems of language and speech therapy, and physical therapy sessions. And provide advising sessions for their parents. And provide children in need with hearing aids.
2-Screeninng for cases and to be  identified and provide with basic and advanced  psychological sessions awareness-raising sessions.
3-Separated children: educational sessions and support groups for separated and unaccompanied children ,workshops, and various activities.
4-To strengthen the local community and build the capacity of workers at CBOs and volunteer training, committees,  have cac meetings 
5-Provide psychological and social services for abused women in the community (sexual violence and gender based violence GBV) as well screening for cases of women subjected to violence on the basis of gender-based, and refer cases to specialized care to provide counseling sessions (medical, social, psychological and legal) for those women.
6- Provide psychological and social services individual and groups sessions (basic and advanced, referral) for those who are having psychological problems ( like bed wetting for children adjustment problems for adultsetc) concentrating on child protection( cp) :prevention, procedures, response, referrals, trainings and workshops
7- cfs for children

Indicator: Number of rehabilitation sessions conducted by a Physical Therapist and/or Occupational Therapist provided to boys under 18 (non Syrian)
comments:
Project Title: Provision of multidisciplinary services for Refugees and Asylum Seekers in Jordan (Syrian) 
Target group:
1-the vulnerable group of Syrian refugee families registered with the UNHCR, especially those with special needs, women, children, the elderly in the community and in the refugee camps.
2-The Community based organizations CBOs Implementing partners and
Funded By: The UN Refugee Agency UNHCR
Activities:
1-To provide rehabilitation services and psycho-social support for children with disabilities from mental disabilities and physical- minor to moderate-, learning difficulties and problems of language and speech therapy, and physical therapy sessions. And provide advising sessions for their parents. And provide children in need with hearing aids.
2-Screeninng for cases and to be  identified and provide with basic and advanced  psychological sessions awareness-raising sessions.
3-Separated children: educational sessions and support groups for separated and unaccompanied children ,workshops, and various activities.
4-To strengthen the local community and build the capacity of workers at CBOs and volunteer training, committees,  have cac meetings 
5-Provide psychological and social services for abused women in the community (sexual violence and gender based violence GBV) as well screening for cases of women subjected to violence on the basis of gender-based, and refer cases to specialized care to provide counseling sessions (medical, social, psychological and legal) for those women.
6- Provide psychological and social services individual and groups sessions (basic and advanced, referral) for those who are having psychological problems ( like bed wetting for children adjustment problems for adultsetc) concentrating on child protection( cp) :prevention, procedures, response, referrals, trainings and workshops
7- cfs for children

Indicator: Syrian Women in Urban - # of GBV survivor who access medical care
comments:
Project title:
a practical emergency prevention and response to GBV and RH among Syrian refugees in Jordan

Objectives:
- To improve awareness and access to quality GBV comprehensive services
-  Improve the capacity of heath units to provide clinical management of rape

Target groups:
1. Refugee and host communities (30%) women, girls, men and boys
2. Partner CBOs and health providers dealing with GBV cases

Description of Activities:
- IFH Psychologists provide psychosocial services and counseling to GBV identified cases
-Training of CBO members and health providers on MISP, Clinical Management of Rape, Code of Conduct, Referral systems (SOP), RH & GBV basics
- Provision of basic and comprehensive RH & GBV medical and counseling services

comments:
Objective:
Provide quality comprehensive RH services and promote reproductive health rights (Primary & Secondary healthcare)

Target groups:
Refugee and Host community (30%) women, men, girls and boys in Amman Gov.

Description of the Project:
IFH will provide critical outreach activities targeting Syrian refugees within the host community to disseminate information on the availability and type of services available to Syrians, and increase access to quality RH and GBV services.

Activities include:
- Conduct awareness activities on RH & GBV
- Provision of RH related medical \ counseling services
- Perform specialized home visits
- Distribution of IEC material
- Conduct campaigns on RH & GBV

Indicator: Number of rehabilitation sessions conducted by a Physical Therapist and/or Occupational Therapist provided to Syrian women 18 and over in urban setting
comments:
Project Title: Provision of multidisciplinary services for Refugees and Asylum Seekers in Jordan (Syrian) 
Target group:
1-the vulnerable group of Syrian refugee families registered with the UNHCR, especially those with special needs, women, children, the elderly in the community and in the refugee camps.
2-The Community based organizations CBOs Implementing partners and
Funded By: The UN Refugee Agency UNHCR
Activities:
1-To provide rehabilitation services and psycho-social support for children with disabilities from mental disabilities and physical- minor to moderate-, learning difficulties and problems of language and speech therapy, and physical therapy sessions. And provide advising sessions for their parents. And provide children in need with hearing aids.
2-Screeninng for cases and to be  identified and provide with basic and advanced  psychological sessions awareness-raising sessions.
3-Separated children: educational sessions and support groups for separated and unaccompanied children ,workshops, and various activities.
4-To strengthen the local community and build the capacity of workers at CBOs and volunteer training, committees,  have cac meetings 
5-Provide psychological and social services for abused women in the community (sexual violence and gender based violence GBV) as well screening for cases of women subjected to violence on the basis of gender-based, and refer cases to specialized care to provide counseling sessions (medical, social, psychological and legal) for those women.
6- Provide psychological and social services individual and groups sessions (basic and advanced, referral) for those who are having psychological problems ( like bed wetting for children adjustment problems for adultsetc) concentrating on child protection( cp) :prevention, procedures, response, referrals, trainings and workshops
7- cfs for children

Indicator: Number of clinical secondary mental health consultations provided to Syrian men 18 and over in urban setting
comments:
CVT Center located in Al Hashmi Al Shamali (North Hashmi).
Number of newly registered clients per month (number of ongoing clients from previous months who were provided services during the reporting month are not including to avoid that the same clients be counted more than once). 
Age group cut-point is 18 years old (girls/boys are below 18 Y/O; women/men are 18 and above). 
The category "Men - Other affected Population" is lacking. In January 2014, 33 "men - other affected population" registered with CVT in Amman.
(Funding resources: BPRM; USAID; UNVFTV; Others)

activity: 3. Access to primary and essential secondary
Indicator: # of health facilities equipped
comments:
Objective:
Provide quality comprehensive RH services and promote reproductive health rights, GBV prevention & response services

Target groups:
Refugee and Host community (30%) women, men, girls and boys in Amman

Description of the Project:
IFH will provide critical outreach activities targeting Syrian refugees within the host community to disseminate information on the availability and type of services available to Syrians, and increase access to quality RH and GBV services.

Activities include:
- Conduct awareness activities on RH & GBV
- Provision of RH related medical \ counseling services
- Perform specialized home visits
- Distribution of IEC material
- Conduct campaigns on RH & GBV

comments: Support the provision of comprehensive mental health services through the bio-psychosocial, multidisciplinary model at 2 MoH outpatient facilities.

activity: 1. Community health volunteer teams in place
Indicator: # of female community health volunteers trained and supported
comments: Community Health Volunteers under one of two IRD health programs, Health Linkages and National Networks (in Amman, Zarqa, and Irbid) and Health Services for Syrian Refugees (Irbid, Ramtha-Irbid, Mafraq, Zarqa, Salt, Karak, Ma'an), conduct health assessments through home visits, make referrals to local Ministry of Health clinics, and spread awareness about healthcare options, and sometimes distribute NFIs to refugees.

Indicator: # caregivers/ mothers reached with IYCF services
comments: Community based awareness and health education on proper Infant and Young Child Feeding practices in personal and group health education sessions

comments: Support the provision of comprehensive mental health services through the bio-psychosocial, multidisciplinary model at 2 MoH outpatient facilities.

comments: Support the provision of comprehensive mental health services through the bio-psychosocial, multidisciplinary model at 2 MoH outpatient facilities.

Indicator: # caregivers/ mothers reached with IYCF services
Number of male health workers (government, CBOs and national NGOs) who have received a complete training session that month
comments:
IRD's Health Linkages and National Networks (HLNN) Program regularly trains Ministry of Health Clinic staff (from clinics which are partnering with the program) on critical health topics. HLNN works in Irbid, Zarqa, and Amman.

Note for March: Due to the high number of activities, IRD does not yet have accurate male/female breakdown of beneficiaries/participants; thus, the total number of participants has been divided equally between males/females for now.

May 2014: gender breakdown now accurate, May training on diagnosis of sexually transmitted diseases. (3 women, 1 man)

6- Provide psychological and social services individual and groups sessions (basic and advanced, referral) for those who are having psychological problems ( like bed wetting for children adjustment problems for adultsetc) concentrating on child protection( cp) :prevention, procedures, response, referrals, trainings and workshops
7- cfs for children

comments:
CVT Center located in Al Hashmi Al Shamali (North Hashmi).

The category "Men - Other affected Population" is lacking. In January 2014, 33 "men - other affected population" registered with CVT in Amman.
(Funding resources: BPRM; USAID; UNVFTV; Others)

Project title:
a practical emergency prevention and response to GBV and RH among Syrian refugees in Jordan

Objectives:
- To improve awareness and access to quality GBV comprehensive services
-  Improve the capacity of heath units to provide clinical management of rape

Target groups:
1. Refugee and host communities (30%) women, girls, men and boys
2. Partner CBOs and health providers dealing with GBV cases

Description of Activities:
- IFH Psychologists provide psychosocial services and counseling to GBV identified cases
-Training of CBO members and health providers on MISP, Clinical Management of Rape, Code of Conduct, Referral systems (SOP), RH & GBV basics
- Provision of basic and comprehensive RH & GBV medical and counseling services

comments:
Project Title: Provision of multidisciplinary services for Refugees and Asylum Seekers in Jordan (Syrian) 
Target group:
1-the vulnerable group of Syrian refugee families registered with the UNHCR, especially those with special needs, women, children, the elderly in the community and in the refugee camps.
2-The Community based organizations CBOs Implementing partners and
Funded By: The UN Refugee Agency UNHCR
Activities:
1-To provide rehabilitation services and psycho-social support for children with disabilities from mental disabilities and physical- minor to moderate-, learning difficulties and problems of language and speech therapy, and physical therapy sessions. And provide advising sessions for their parents. And provide children in need with hearing aids.
2-Screeninng for cases and to be  identified and provide with basic and advanced  psychological sessions awareness-raising sessions.
3-Separated children: educational sessions and support groups for separated and unaccompanied children ,workshops, and various activities.
4-To strengthen the local community and build the capacity of workers at CBOs and volunteer training, committees,  have cac meetings 
5-Provide psychological and social services for abused women in the community (sexual violence and gender based violence GBV) as well screening for cases of women subjected to violence on the basis of gender-based, and refer cases to specialized care to provide counseling sessions (medical, social, psychological and legal) for those women.
6- Provide psychological and social services individual and groups sessions (basic and advanced, referral) for those who are having psychological problems ( like bed wetting for children adjustment problems for adultsetc) concentrating on child protection( cp) :prevention, procedures, response, referrals, trainings and workshops
7- cfs for children

- IFH Psychologists provide psychosocial services and counseling to GBV identified cases

Indicator: Number of female health workers (government, CBOs and national NGOs) who have received a complete training session that month
comments:
IRD's Health Linkages and National Networks (HLNN) Program regularly trains Ministry of Health Clinic staff (from clinics which are partnering with the program) on critical health topics. HLNN works in Irbid, Zarqa, and Amman.

Note for March: Due to the high number of activities, IRD does not yet have accurate male/female breakdown of beneficiaries/participants; thus, the total number of participants has been divided equally between males/females for now.

May 2014: gender breakdown now accurate, May training on diagnosis of sexually transmitted diseases. (3 women, 1 man)

3-Separated children: educational sessions and support groups for separated and unaccompanied children ,workshops, and various activities.
4-To strengthen the local community and build the capacity of workers at CBOs and volunteer training, committees,  have cac meetings 
5-Provide psychological and social services for abused women in the community (sexual violence and gender based violence GBV) as well screening for cases of women subjected to violence on the basis of gender-based, and refer cases to specialized care to provide counseling sessions (medical, social, psychological and legal) for those women.
6- Provide psychological and social services individual and groups sessions (basic and advanced, referral) for those who are having psychological problems ( like bed wetting for children adjustment problems for adultsetc) concentrating on child protection( cp) :prevention, procedures, response, referrals, trainings and workshops
7- cfs for children

comments:
Objective:
- Provide quality comprehensive RH services and promote reproductive health rights
- Provide care and referral of GBV survivors

Target groups:
Refugee and Host community (30%) women, men, girls and boys in the northern areas (Northern Jordan Valley)

Description of the Project:
IFH will provide critical outreach activities targeting Syrian refugees within the host community to disseminate information on the availability and type of services available to Syrians, and increase access to quality RH and GBV services.

Activities include:
- Conduct awareness activities on RH & GBV
- Provision of RH related medical \ counseling services including ANC
- Perform specialized home visits
- Distribution of IEC material
- Conduct campaigns on RH & GBV

Indicator: Syrian Men in Urban - # of GBV survivor who access medical care
comments:
Comments: Project title:
a practical emergency prevention and response to GBV and RH among Syrian refugees in Jordan

Objectives:
- To improve awareness and access to quality GBV comprehensive services
- Improve the capacity of heath units to provide clinical management of rape

Target groups:
1. Refugee and host communities (30%) women, girls, men and boys
2. Partner CBOs and health providers dealing with GBV cases

Description of Activities:
- IFH Psychologists provide psychosocial services and counseling to GBV identified cases
-Training of CBO members and health providers on MISP, Clinical Management of Rape, Code of Conduct, Referral systems (SOP), RH & GBV basics
- Provision of basic and comprehensive RH & GBV medical and counseling services

Indicator: # of primary healthcare consultations provided
Syrian Women in Urban - # of GBV survivor who access medical care
comments:
Comments: Project title:
a practical emergency prevention and response to GBV and RH among Syrian refugees in Jordan

Objectives:
- To improve awareness and access to quality GBV comprehensive services
- Improve the capacity of heath units to provide clinical management of rape

Target groups:
1. Refugee and host communities (30%) women, girls, men and boys
2. Partner CBOs and health providers dealing with GBV cases

Description of Activities:
- IFH Psychologists provide psychosocial services and counseling to GBV identified cases
-Training of CBO members and health providers on MISP, Clinical Management of Rape, Code of Conduct, Referral systems (SOP), RH & GBV basics
- Provision of basic and comprehensive RH & GBV medical and counseling services

activity: 1. Community health volunteer teams in place
Indicator: # of female community health volunteers trained and supported
comments:
Objective:
Provide quality comprehensive RH services and promote reproductive health rights

Target groups:
Refugee women, men, girls and boys

Description of the Project:
IFH will provide critical outreach activities targeting Syrian refugees within the host community to disseminate information on the availability and type of services available to Syrians, and increase access to quality RH and GBV services.

Activities include:
- Conduct awareness activities on RH & GBV
- Provision of RH related medical \ counseling services
- Perform specialized home visits
- Distribution of IEC material
- Conduct campaigns on RH & GBV

activity: 2. Community level referral system in place
Indicator: community level referral system established?
comments: IRD's community health referral systems are implemented through two comparable programs, Health Linkages and National Networks (in Amman, Zarqa, and Irbid) and Health Services for Syrian Refugees (Irbid, Ramtha-Irbid, Mafraq, Zarqa, Salt, Karak, Ma'an). Both involve teams of Community Health Volunteers (CHVs), who conduct health assessments through home visits for refugees and Jordanian residents of host communities, provide increased awareness of healthcare options (saving time and trouble for both beneficiaries and clinics), and make referrals to local Ministry of Health clinics. They follow up with patients throughout their treatment, ensuring that referrals for higher level care are given when necessary, and conducting exit interviews upon completion of treatment to evaluate services. When NFI donations are available they are also often circulated through CHVs.

Indicator: Number of clinical secondary mental health consultations provided to Syrian women 18 and over in camp
comments:
Project Title: Provision of multidisciplinary services for Refugees and Asylum Seekers in Jordan (Syrian) 
Target group:
1-the vulnerable group of Syrian refugee families registered with the UNHCR, especially those with special needs, women, children, the elderly in the community and in the refugee camps.
2-The Community based organizations CBOs Implementing partners and
Funded By: The UN Refugee Agency UNHCR
Activities:  (in the camps and the local community)
1-To provide rehabilitation services and psycho-social support for children with disabilities from mental disabilities and physical- minor to moderate-, learning difficulties and problems of language and speech therapy, and physical therapy sessions. And provide advising sessions for their parents. And provide children in need with hearing aids.
2-Screeninng for cases and to be  identified and provide with basic and advanced  psychological sessions awareness-raising sessions.
3-Separated children: educational sessions and support groups for separated and unaccompanied children ,workshops, and various activities. and individual psychosocial sessions as well referrals
4- Provide psychological and social services individual and groups sessions for those who are having psychological problems ( like bed wetting for children adjustment problems for adultsetc)

activity: 2. Community level referral system in place
Indicator: community level referral system established?
comments:
Objective:
Provide quality comprehensive RH services and promote reproductive health rights

Target groups:
Refugee  women, men, girls and boys

Description of the Project:
IFH will provide critical outreach activities targeting Syrian refugees within the host community to disseminate information on the availability and type of services available to Syrians, and increase access to quality RH and GBV services.

Activities include:
- Conduct awareness activities on RH & GBV
- Provision of RH related medical \ counseling services
- Perform specialized home visits
- Distribution of IEC material
- Conduct campaigns on RH & GBV

Indicator: Syrian Women in Urban - # of GBV survivor who access medical care
comments:
Comments: Project title:
a practical emergency prevention and response to GBV and RH among Syrian refugees in Jordan

Objectives:
- To improve awareness and access to quality GBV comprehensive services
- Improve the capacity of heath units to provide clinical management of rape

Target groups:
1. Refugee and host communities (30%) women, girls, men and boys
2. Partner CBOs and health providers dealing with GBV cases

Description of Activities:
- IFH Psychologists provide psychosocial services and counseling to GBV identified cases
-Training of CBO members and health providers on MISP, Clinical Management of Rape, Code of Conduct, Referral systems (SOP), RH & GBV basics
- Provision of basic and comprehensive RH & GBV medical and counseling services

Support the integration of mental health in PHC through the delivery of mhGAP supervision and provision of tools to 16 facilities in Amman, Mafraq, Irbid and Ramtha, in coordination with MOH Mental Health Unit. 

Target is 8 additional PHC facilities, bringing total number to 24 facilities (country-wide).

activity: 1. Community health volunteer teams in place
Indicator: # of male  community health volunteers trained and supported
comments:
Objective:
Provide quality comprehensive RH services and promote reproductive health rights

Target groups:
Refugee women, men, girls and boys

Description of the Project:
IFH will provide critical outreach activities targeting Syrian refugees within the host community to disseminate information on the availability and type of services available to Syrians, and increase access to quality RH and GBV services.

Activities include:
- Conduct awareness activities on RH & GBV
- Provision of RH related medical \ counseling services
- Perform specialized home visits
- Distribution of IEC material
- Conduct campaigns on RH & GBV

Indicator: Number of clinical secondary mental health consultations provided to Syrian men 18 and over in camp
comments:
Project Title: Provision of multidisciplinary services for Refugees and Asylum Seekers in Jordan (Syrian) 
Target group:
1-the vulnerable group of Syrian refugee families registered with the UNHCR, especially those with special needs, women, children, the elderly in the community and in the refugee camps.
2-The Community based organizations CBOs Implementing partners and
Funded By: The UN Refugee Agency UNHCR
Activities:  (in the camps and the local community)
1-To provide rehabilitation services and psycho-social support for children with disabilities from mental disabilities and physical- minor to moderate-, learning difficulties and problems of language and speech therapy, and physical therapy sessions. And provide advising sessions for their parents. And provide children in need with hearing aids.
2-Screeninng for cases and to be  identified and provide with basic and advanced  psychological sessions awareness-raising sessions.
3-Separated children: educational sessions and support groups for separated and unaccompanied children ,workshops, and various activities. and individual psychosocial sessions as well referrals
4- Provide psychological and social services individual and groups sessions for those who are having psychological problems ( like bed wetting for children adjustment problems for adultsetc)

Indicator: Number of clinical secondary mental health consultations provided to Syrian women 18 and over in camp
comments:
Project Title: Provision of multidisciplinary services for Refugees and Asylum Seekers in Jordan (Syrian) 
Target group:
1-the vulnerable group of Syrian refugee families registered with the UNHCR, especially those with special needs, women, children, the elderly in the community and in the refugee camps.
2-The Community based organizations CBOs Implementing partners and
Funded By: The UN Refugee Agency UNHCR
Activities:  (in the camps and the local community)
1-To provide rehabilitation services and psycho-social support for children with disabilities from mental disabilities and physical- minor to moderate-, learning difficulties and problems of language and speech therapy, and physical therapy sessions. And provide advising sessions for their parents. And provide children in need with hearing aids.
2-Screeninng for cases and to be  identified and provide with basic and advanced  psychological sessions awareness-raising sessions.
3-Separated children: educational sessions and support groups for separated and unaccompanied children ,workshops, and various activities. and individual psychosocial sessions as well referrals
4- Provide psychological and social services individual and groups sessions for those who are having psychological problems ( like bed wetting for children adjustment problems for adultsetc)

Target is 8 additional PHC facilities, bringing total number to 24 facilities (country-wide).

activity: 2. Community level referral system in place
Indicator: community level referral system established?
comments: IRD's community health referral systems are implemented through two comparable programs, Health Linkages and National Networks (in Amman, Zarqa, and Irbid) and Health Services for Syrian Refugees (Irbid, Ramtha-Irbid, Mafraq, Zarqa, Salt, Karak, Ma'an). Both involve teams of Community Health Volunteers (CHVs), who conduct health assessments through home visits for refugees and Jordanian residents of host communities, provide increased awareness of healthcare options (saving time and trouble for both beneficiaries and clinics), and make referrals to local Ministry of Health clinics. They follow up with patients throughout their treatment, ensuring that referrals for higher level care are given when necessary, and conducting exit interviews upon completion of treatment to evaluate services. When NFI donations are available they are also often circulated through CHVs.

activity: 1. Community health volunteer teams in place
Indicator: # of female community health volunteers trained and supported
comments: Community Health Volunteers under one of two IRD health programs, Health Linkages and National Networks (in Amman, Zarqa, and Irbid) and Health Services for Syrian Refugees (Irbid, Ramtha-Irbid, Mafraq, Zarqa, Salt, Karak, Ma'an), conduct health assessments through home visits, make referrals to local Ministry of Health clinics, and spread awareness about healthcare options, and sometimes distribute NFIs to refugees.

activity: 1. Community health volunteer teams in place
Indicator: # of female community health volunteers trained and supported
comments:
Objective:
Provide quality comprehensive RH services and promote reproductive health rights

Target groups:
Refugee women, men, girls and boys

Description of the Project:
IFH will provide critical outreach activities targeting Syrian refugees within the host community to disseminate information on the availability and type of services available to Syrians, and increase access to quality RH and GBV services.

Activities include:
- Conduct awareness activities on RH & GBV
- Provision of RH related medical \ counseling services
- Perform specialized home visits
- Distribution of IEC material
- Conduct campaigns on RH & GBV

activity: 1. Community health volunteer teams in place
Indicator: # of female community health volunteers trained and supported
comments:
Objective:
Provide quality comprehensive RH services and promote reproductive health rights

Target groups:
Refugee women, men, girls and boys

Description of the Project:
IFH will provide critical outreach activities targeting Syrian refugees within the host community to disseminate information on the availability and type of services available to Syrians, and increase access to quality RH and GBV services.

Activities include:
- Conduct awareness activities on RH & GBV
- Provision of RH related medical \ counseling services
- Perform specialized home visits
- Distribution of IEC material
- Conduct campaigns on RH & GBV

comments:
Project Title: Provision of multidisciplinary services for Refugees and Asylum Seekers in Jordan (Syrian) 
Target group:
1-the vulnerable group of Syrian refugee families registered with the UNHCR, especially those with special needs, women, children, the elderly in the community and in the refugee camps.
2-The Community based organizations CBOs Implementing partners and
Funded By: The UN Refugee Agency UNHCR
Activities:  (in the camps and the local community)
1-To provide rehabilitation services and psycho-social support for children with disabilities from mental disabilities and physical- minor to moderate-, learning difficulties and problems of language and speech therapy, and physical therapy sessions. And provide advising sessions for their parents. And provide children in need with hearing aids.
2-Screeninng for cases and to be  identified and provide with basic and advanced  psychological sessions awareness-raising sessions.
3-Separated children: educational sessions and support groups for separated and unaccompanied children ,workshops, and various activities. and individual psychosocial sessions as well referrals
4- Provide psychological and social services individual and groups sessions for those who are having psychological problems ( like bed wetting for children adjustment problems for adultsetc)

activity: 2. Community level referral system in place
Indicator: community level referral system established?
comments: IRD's community health referral systems are implemented through two comparable programs, Health Linkages and National Networks (in Amman, Zarqa, and Irbid) and Health Services for Syrian Refugees (Irbid, Ramtha-Irbid, Mafraq, Zarqa, Salt, Karak, Ma'an). Both involve teams of Community Health Volunteers (CHVs), who conduct health assessments through home visits for refugees and Jordanian residents of host communities, provide increased awareness of healthcare options (saving time and trouble for both beneficiaries and clinics), and make referrals to local Ministry of Health clinics. They follow up with patients throughout their treatment, ensuring that referrals for higher level care are given when necessary, and conducting exit interviews upon completion of treatment to evaluate services. When NFI donations are available they are also often circulated through CHVs.

activity: 2. Community level referral system in place
Indicator: community level referral system established?
comments:
Objective:
Provide quality comprehensive RH services and promote reproductive health rights

Target groups:
Refugee women, men, girls and boys 

Description of the Project:
IFH will provide critical outreach activities targeting Syrian refugees within the host community to disseminate information on the availability and type of services available to Syrians, and increase access to quality RH and GBV services.

Activities include:
- Conduct awareness activities on RH & GBV
- Provision of RH related medical \ counseling services
- Perform specialized home visits
- Distribution of IEC material
- Conduct campaigns on RH & GBV

comments:
Objective:
Provide quality comprehensive RH services and promote reproductive health rights

Target groups:
Refugee women, men, girls and boys 

Description of the Project:
IFH will provide critical outreach activities targeting Syrian refugees within the host community to disseminate information on the availability and type of services available to Syrians, and increase access to quality RH and GBV services.

Activities include:
- Conduct awareness activities on RH & GBV
- Provision of RH related medical \ counseling services
- Perform specialized home visits
- Distribution of IEC material
- Conduct campaigns on RH & GBV

comments:
Objective: 
- Provide quality comprehensive RH services and promote reproductive health rights
- Provide care and referral of GBV survivors

Target groups: 
Refugee and Host community (30%) women, men, girls and boys in the northern areas (Ajlun and Jarash)

Description of the Project:
IFH will provide critical outreach activities targeting Syrian refugees within the host community to disseminate information on the availability and type of services available to Syrians, and increase access to quality RH and GBV services.

Activities include:
- Conduct awareness activities on RH & GBV
- Provision of RH related medical \ counseling services including ANC
- Perform specialized home visits
- Distribution of IEC material
- Conduct campaigns on RH & GBV

Syrian Girls in Urban - # of GBV survivor who access medical care
comments:
Comments: Project title:
a practical emergency prevention and response to GBV and RH among Syrian refugees in Jordan

Objectives:
- To improve awareness and access to quality GBV comprehensive services
- Improve the capacity of heath units to provide clinical management of rape

Target groups:
1. Refugee and host communities (30%) women, girls, men and boys
2. Partner CBOs and health providers dealing with GBV cases

Description of Activities:
- IFH Psychologists provide psychosocial services and counseling to GBV identified cases
-Training of CBO members and health providers on MISP, Clinical Management of Rape, Code of Conduct, Referral systems (SOP), RH & GBV basics
- Provision of basic and comprehensive RH & GBV medical and counseling services

Indicator: Syrian Women in Urban - # of GBV survivor who access medical care

activity: 2. Community level referral system in place
Indicator: community level referral system established?
comments: IRD's community health referral systems are implemented through two comparable programs, Health Linkages and National Networks (in Amman, Zarqa, and Irbid) and Health Services for Syrian Refugees (Irbid, Ramtha-Irbid, Mafraq, Zarqa, Salt, Karak, Ma'an). Both involve teams of Community Health Volunteers (CHVs), who conduct health assessments through home visits for refugees and Jordanian residents of host communities, provide increased awareness of healthcare options (saving time and trouble for both beneficiaries and clinics), and make referrals to local Ministry of Health clinics. They follow up with patients throughout their treatment, ensuring that referrals for higher level care are given when necessary, and conducting exit interviews upon completion of treatment to evaluate services. When NFI donations are available they are also often circulated through CHVs.

activity: 2. Community level referral system in place
Indicator: community level referral system established?
comments: IRD's community health referral systems are implemented through two comparable programs, Health Linkages and National Networks (in Amman, Zarqa, and Irbid) and Health Services for Syrian Refugees (Irbid, Ramtha-Irbid, Mafraq, Zarqa, Salt, Karak, Ma'an). Both involve teams of Community Health Volunteers (CHVs), who conduct health assessments through home visits for refugees and Jordanian residents of host communities, provide increased awareness of healthcare options (saving time and trouble for both beneficiaries and clinics), and make referrals to local Ministry of Health clinics. They follow up with patients throughout their treatment, ensuring that referrals for higher level care are given when necessary, and conducting exit interviews upon completion of treatment to evaluate services. When NFI donations are available they are also often circulated through CHVs.

comments:
Project Title: Provision of multidisciplinary services for Refugees and Asylum Seekers in Jordan (Syrian) 

Target group:
1-the vulnerable group of Syrian refugee families registered with the UNHCR, especially those with special needs, women, children, the elderly in the community and in the refugee camps.
2-The Community based organizations CBOs Implementing partners 
Funded By: The UN Refugee Agency UNHCR
Activities: 
1-To provide rehabilitation services and psycho-social support for children with disabilities from mental disabilities and physical- minor to moderate-, learning difficulties and problems of language and speech therapy, and physical therapy sessions. And provide advising sessions for their parents. And provide children in need with hearing aids.

comments:
Project Title: Provision of multidisciplinary services for Refugees and Asylum Seekers in Jordan (Syrian) 

Target group:
1-the vulnerable group of Syrian refugee families registered with the UNHCR, especially those with special needs, women, children, the elderly in the community and in the refugee camps.
2-The Community based organizations CBOs Implementing partners 
Funded By: The UN Refugee Agency UNHCR
Activities: 
1-To provide rehabilitation services and psycho-social support for children with disabilities from mental disabilities and physical- minor to moderate-, learning difficulties and problems of language and speech therapy, and physical therapy sessions. And provide advising sessions for their parents. And provide children in need with hearing aids.

activity: 2. Community level referral system in place
Indicator: community level referral system established?
comments: IRD's community health referral system in Za'atri is implemented through the Health Services for Syrian Refugees program and involves a team of resident Community Health Volunteers (CHVs), who conduct health assessments through home visits for refugees in all districts of the camp, provide awareness of healthcare options and health lifestyles (saving time and trouble for both beneficiaries and clinics), and make referrals to local clinics. They follow up with patients throughout their treatment, ensuring that they receive referrals for higher level care when necessary, and conducting exit interviews upon completion of treatment to evaluate services. When NFI donations are available they are also often circulated through CHVs.

activity: 2. Community level referral system in place
Indicator: community level referral system established?
comments: IRD's community health referral system in Za'atri is implemented through the Health Services for Syrian Refugees program and involves a team of resident Community Health Volunteers (CHVs), who conduct health assessments through home visits for refugees in all districts of the camp, provide awareness of healthcare options and health lifestyles (saving time and trouble for both beneficiaries and clinics), and make referrals to local clinics. They follow up with patients throughout their treatment, ensuring that they receive referrals for higher level care when necessary, and conducting exit interviews upon completion of treatment to evaluate services. When NFI donations are available they are also often circulated through CHVs.
